simpledes: Post-tax private income corresponds to all sources of incomes
shorttype: received by individuals and which can be individualized (this excludes social transfers in kind
longtype: collective consumption expenditure and government deficit).
shortpop: Post-tax disposable income=Pre-tax income-Taxes on production (net)-Current taxes on income and wealth+Social assistance benefits in cash
shortage: Average income or wealth between two percentiles. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX'
longage: intermediary average returns the average between percentile pX and the next consecutive percentile. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY'
unit: the variable returns the average between percentiles pX and pY.
method: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
data_points: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
column23: “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)
column24: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1980: survey + concept correction + tax data
column25: 1981-1989: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data
column27: 1992-1993: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data
column29: 2002: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data
